attachments.text:
See Heather's report at <https://r-contributors.slack.com/archives/C0210D7EN1X/p1692202777431149|https://r-contributors.slack.com/archives/C0210D7EN1X/p1692202777431149>

> For the base package it seems that the R strings might have got confused with the C strings. For example <https://translate.rx.studio/projects/r-project/base-c/ne/|base (C) files - Nepali> shows 573 strings, the same as <https://translate.rx.studio/projects/r-project/base-r/fr/|base (R) files - French>, while <https://translate.rx.studio/projects/r-project/base-c/fr/|base (C) - French> only has 15 strings. There is no base (R) files for Nepali, maybe that is causing the issue?

text: that was originally caused by a misconfiguration of a weblate compontent, which was fixed at the R Project Sprint (Aug/Sept of last year) - so if the Catalan translations were started after that (sorry, I don't remember), then we still have the issue .. if the translation files were started before the fix, then it should not occur later :crossed_fingers:

text: I’ve just found that before we created that channel we already had started somehow mid-September 2023. in this <https://r-contributors.slack.com/archives/C0210D7EN1X/p1694719906045079?thread_ts=1694689550.295239&cid=C0210D7EN1X|thread> you said by then that you created the Catalan language team in Weblate. elements.text:
I've created the Catalan language team in weblate and made you admin of that. you can add further reviewers for the language on your own as per the Weblate FAQ (or let me know if you need help)

thanks for leading the Catalan translations

text:
thanks, <@U02HVUBA4QY>! I've looked at the related git log and indeed seems that the translation started earlier:

```$ git log --reverse --pretty=format:"%h%x09%an%x09%ad%x09%s" src/library/base/po/ca.po | head -n 3
1645f3eda8      Joan Maspons    Wed Aug 16 12:59:29 2023 +0000  Added translation using Weblate (Catalan)
99464c6f93      Joan Maspons    Wed Aug 16 15:19:31 2023 +0000  Translated using Weblate (Catalan)
100ed2d58d      Joan Maspons    Sun Sep 10 00:50:15 2023 +0000  Translated using Weblate (Catalan)```

elements.text: ! I've looked at the related git log and indeed seems that the translation started earlier:

$ git log --reverse --pretty=format:"%h%x09%an%x09%ad%x09%s" src/library/base/po/ca.po | head -n 3

text:
and the problem is that previously the `base` R po file were based on the `base` C `pot` file .. so now `src/library/base/po/ca.po` is exactly the same as `src/library/base/po/R-ca.po`
this is something I previously resolved for Hindi and the other reported languages by `git mv` if I recall correctly, that we should do for Catalan as well. sorry for the trouble!
I will report back if it's resolved (looking into it now)

text: That sounds promising, I still don’t get even if `ca.po` was the same as `R-ca.po` why I could only get 15 messages to translate in Weblate (see my screen capture above from yesterday), because generating those files fresh from `R-base.pot` and `R.pot` gives thousands of messages, not 15. Anyway, if this could not be resolved on Weblate before generating the patch, I’ll be happy to provide the `R-ca.po` and `ca.po` files with the few starting messages translated into Catalan, if it would be possible to use them in the patch with the rest of the Weblate translated po files.
